description: What Is Man?, published by Mark Twain in 1906, is a dialogue between a young man and an older man jaded to the world. It involves ideas of destiny and free will, as well as of psychological egoism. The Old Man asserted that the human being is merely a machine, and nothing more. The Young Man objects, and asks him to go into particulars and furnish his reasons for his position. This collection includes fourteen other essays by Mark Twain such as the following notable titles: Is Shakespeare Dead?, Taming the Bicycle, The Memorable Assassination, and The Turning-Point of My Life. To have access to these classic titles download our ebook today!
